intro: Chamaesyce linearis, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the family Cariophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Chamaesyce linearis is a low-growing perennial that is well adapted to drought conditions.
